ImageLoader¶

class ImageLoader(image_dir: str, targets: numpy.ndarray, channels: int = 3, im_shape: tuple = None, batch_size: int = 32, shuffle: bool = True)¶

Bases: bluebird.dataloader.dataloaderbase.DataLoaderBase

__init__(image_dir: str, targets: numpy.ndarray, channels: int = 3, im_shape: tuple = None, batch_size: int = 32, shuffle: bool = True)¶

Initalizes the object.

Parameters

  • image_dir (str) – location of base images directory

  • targets (Tensor) – target data, note: order must be the same as filenames in directory

  • channels (int) – number of channels of images, 1: grayscale, 3: rgb, 4: rgba, defautls to 3

  • im_shape (tuple, optional) – define if you want to reshape the image, None = default image shape

  • batch_size (int, optional) – length of every batch size, defaults to 32

  • shuffle (bool, optional) – shuffles data if true, defaults to True

Methods

__init__(image_dir, targets[, channels, …])

Initalizes the object.

preload()

Loads the file names as Tensor
